main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted near Albuquerque, New Mexico on 10th March 1949. The object was spherical, yellow in color, and approximately two times the size of an automobile headlight. It traveled at an estimated speed of 200 MPH from east to west, maintaining a horizontal path and emitting no sound or exhaust trail.
interesting points: The sighting was reported by Cpl. Paul James Hutchinson of the 8457th M.P. Company at Sandia Base.
The object was observed at an altitude of 300' to 400' elevation and had no apparent effect on the clouds or weather conditions.
No photographs of the UFO were taken, and there were no other witnesses to the sighting.
The observer had no previous experience as an observer, indicating that it was an unanticipated event for a trained observer.
The report was declassified on 25th March 1949 and forwarded to the Commanding General of the Air Materiel Command at Wright Patterson Air Force Base in Ohio.
